trans-unit.source: allows you to create user-defined types. A user-defined type is a serializable Java class whose instances are stored in columns. The class must implement the java.io.Serializable interface.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> allows you to create user-defined types.
A user-defined type is a serializable Java class whose instances are stored in columns.
The class must implement the java.io.Serializable interface.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> allows you to create user-defined types.
A user-defined type is a serializable Java class whose instances are stored in columns.
The class must implement the java.io.Serializable interface.

trans-unit.source: For information on creating and removing types, see <xref href="rrefsqljcreatetype.dita#rrefsqljcreatetype"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqljdroptype.dita#rrefsqljdroptype"></xref>. See <xref href="rrefsqljgrant.dita#rrefsqljgrant"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqljrevoke.dita#rrefsqljrevoke"></xref> for information on usage privileges for types.

seg-source.mrk: For information on creating and removing types, see <xref href="rrefsqljcreatetype.dita#rrefsqljcreatetype"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqljdroptype.dita#rrefsqljdroptype"></xref>.
See <xref href="rrefsqljgrant.dita#rrefsqljgrant"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqljrevoke.dita#rrefsqljrevoke"></xref> for information on usage privileges for types.

target.mrk: For information on creating and removing types, see <xref href="rrefsqljcreatetype.dita#rrefsqljcreatetype"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqljdroptype.dita#rrefsqljdroptype"></xref>.
See <xref href="rrefsqljgrant.dita#rrefsqljgrant"></xref> and <xref href="rrefsqljrevoke.dita#rrefsqljrevoke"></xref> for information on usage privileges for types.

trans-unit.source: For information on writing the Java classes that implement user-defined types, see "Programming user-defined types" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For information on writing the Java classes that implement user-defined types, see "Programming user-defined types" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.
